subject: Ethics
title: Physician-Assisted Dying Debate
description: A quick, practical guide to Physician-Assisted Dying Debate.

hook.text: A doctor hands a patient a lethal prescription but doesn't administer it. Is the doctor killing or helping?

buildup.text: Physician-assisted dying means a doctor provides the means, but the patient takes the final action themselves.

discovery.text: Oregon's 1997 Death with Dignity Act became the first U.S. law allowing it, with strict eligibility criteria.

twist.text: Many eligible patients never fill the prescription. Just knowing the option exists brings them peace.

climax.text: The debate splits doctors: some see it as the ultimate compassion, others as a betrayal of their healing oath.

punchline.text: The pill sits on the nightstand. Choice is the real medicine.
